text: Angelique Kerber was the two-time defending champion, but lost in the second round to Kristina Mladenovic. As a result of her loss, Serena Williams regained the world no.1 ranking, despite being on a pregnancy leave. The tournament marked the return of Maria Sharapova, after serving a 15-month suspension. Laura Siegemund won the title, defeating Mladenovic in the final, 6–1, 2–6, 7–6(7–5). == Seeds == The top four seeds receive a bye into the second round. == Draw == === Finals === === Top half === === Bottom half === == Qualifying == === Seeds === === Qualifiers === === Lucky Loser === === Draw === ==== First qualifier ==== ==== Second qualifier ==== ====Third qualifier==== ====Fourth qualifier==== ==Notes== == References == * Main Draw * Qualifying Draw Porsche Tennis Grand Prix Singles 2017 Women's Singles
title: 2017 Porsche Tennis Grand Prix – Singles
